title: Cat. 10  Porringer, c. 1725
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Moody Russell (American, 1694–1761)  
Barnstable, Massachusetts   
Silver; 3.8 × 15.2 × 10.2 cm (1 1/2 × 6 1/4 × 4 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of the Antiquarian Society, 1956.176

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">Near handle (fig. 10.1)

Engraved on top of handle: A / P\*A (fig. 10.2)

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With Robert Ensko, New York, by 1956.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1956.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, p. 145, cat. 172.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Tvrdik (1977), p. 145, cat. 172.

Kane et al. (1998), p. 875.

</section><section id="figures">Porringer, c. 1725.

fig. 10.1 fig. 10.2 </section>
